intro: Hieracium boltigense, commonly known as the Boltingen hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped, with yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Hieracium boltigense is often found in open habitats and is relatively hardy, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
